intro: Oxydectes mongue, commonly known as the Mongolian oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are often divided and can be used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Oxydectes mongue is relatively rare and faces threats from habitat loss and overharvesting.
